references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 2: The Aircraft

questions.question: The __________ of an aircraft must ensure that the aircraft is maintained in an airworth condition.
With regard to maintenance, what does AD stand for and how does it relate to aircraft airworthiness?
questions.answer: Airworthiness Directive. All applicable ADs must be complied with

questions.question: All defects must be rectified before flight, except for which instruments and equipment?
questions.answer: Any permitted to be inoperative under part 91.537 (either by MEL, or aircraft under 5700kg and meeting the other conditions of 91.537, or with a special flight permit).

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.537 - Inoperative instruments and equipment)

questions.question: The aircraft must be maintained under a Maintenance Programme approved under: Part 119 (specifically for ___ __________), or Part 91 (specifically for aircraft issued with a __________/__________ airworthiness certificate), or under the __________ maintenance schedule.

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.607 - Approval of maintenance programmes)

questions.question: The aircraft must be inspected in conformity with Part ___, or the __________ __________ __________ (OMM), or in conformity with another approved maintenance programme.
An inspection must be performed every ___ months, or ___ hours, whichever comes __________. What is the exception to this?
questions.answer: 12. 100. If the aircraft is maintained under a maintenance schedule which doesn't require an annual or 100 hour inspection.

questions.question: How often (at least) must the following systems be inspected? Radios, (for operations under IFR): ___ months, static pressure and altimeter systems: ___ months, transponders: ___ months, ELTs: ___ months or ___ hours, whichever is __________.
questions.answer: 24 months. 24 months. 24 months. 12 months. 100 hours. Sooner.

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.605(e) - Maintenance programmes and schedules)

questions.question: How often must a Review of Airworthiness be carried out?
questions.answer: Within the preceeding 12 months, or within the preceding 24 months for an aircraft not operated for hire or reward.

questions.question: How often must a Maintenance Review be carried out. Maintenance review requirements are in CAR Part ___.
Instruments or equipment permitted to be inoperative must be __________ and details recorded in the __________ __________ __________.
